page.title: 06FARMING AT BERE FERRERS
page.content: Most of our Domesday block is farmland. We have at least thirty farms on our block. They have cattle, sheep and crops. There are wide local variations in climate: frost and snow occur, but they are very short-lived. The less sheltered land is used for arable and dairy farming. Dairy farming is changing from milk production to beef production as a result of the E.E.C. quotas. The main breed are Friesians and there is a regular milk tanker. Several farmers have sheep and there were signs of pig-farming. Many people raise their own chickens, geese and ducks. A fair proportion of the fields are arable, but they are used for potatoes, barley and kale, mainly for cattle feed, although some of the potatoes are sold in Plymouth to green-grocers and fish and chip shops.
